required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Ingesting or Rinsing Sucrose and Sucralose on Self-control, Cognitive Performance, and Blood Glucose
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Ingesting or Rinsing Sucrose and Sucralose Solutions on Self-control, Cognitive Performance, and Blood Glucose Level

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the effects of ingesting or mouth rinsing a sucrose (carbohydrate) versus a sucralose (carbohydrate-free) drink on self control, cognitive performance, and blood glucose level.

primary_outcome.measure: Capillary blood glucose change from baseline following rinsing or ingesting sucrose or sucralose solutions
primary_outcome.time_frame: - 30, -15, - 5, + 5, + 10, + 20, + 30, + 40 minutes relative to rinsing or ingestion of sucrose or sucralose solutions (each separated by 7 days in crossover manner)
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in capillary blood glucose (assessed by lancet fingerprick and YSI blood glucose analyser)

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual verbal learning and memory performance following self-control depletion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: + 35 minutes post ingestion or rinsing of sucrose or sucralose solutions (each separated by 7 days in crossover manner)
secondary_outcome.description: Visual verbal learning performance will be assessed by the Visual Verbal Learning Test (Rey, 1964) following a self-control depletion task and ingestion or rinsing of a sucrose or sucralose solution

secondary_outcome.measure: Attention switching performance following self-control depletion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: + 20 minutes post ingestion or rinsing of sucrose or sucralose solutions (each separated by 7 days in crossover manner)
secondary_outcome.description: Attention switching performance will be assessed by a switch task (Rogers and Monsell, 1995) following a self-control depletion task and ingestion or rinsing of a sucrose or sucralose solution

secondary_outcome.measure: Continuous blood glucose change from baseline following rinsing or ingesting sucrose or sucralose solutions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours preceding and during ingestion or rinsing of sucrose or sucralose solutions (each separated by 7 days in a crossover manner)
secondary_outcome.description: A subgroup of 10 participants recruited into the study will be fitted with a continuous glucose monitoring device (CGMS, iPRO) the day preceding each of the test days to measure continuous interstitial blood glucose levels

arm_group.description: A 381g blackcurrant drink (cordial and water) providing 50g of sucrose
A 381g blackcurrant drink (cordial and water) providing 0.92g of natural sugars

intervention.description: Participants rinse the solution in the oral cavity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI 18 - 29 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Dementia
- Depression
- Type 2 diabetes
- Phenylketonuria
- Intake of medication known to affect glucose metabolism
- Fasting blood glucose > 7.8 mmol/L

facility.name: Human Appetite Research Unit (University of Leeds)
